name: CKEDITOR.dom.walker
doc:
Utility class to "walk" the DOM inside a range boundaries. If the range starts or ends in the middle of the text node this node will be included as a whole. Outside changes to the range may break the walker.

The walker may return nodes that are not totaly included into the range boundaires. Let's take the following range representation, where the square brackets indicate the boundaries:

[<p>Some <b>sample] text</b>

While walking forward into the above range, the following nodes are returned: <p>, "Some ", <b> and "sample". Going backwards instead we have: "sample" and "Some ". So note that the walker always returns nodes when "entering" them, but not when "leaving" them. The guard function is instead called both when entering and leaving nodes.

members.name: evaluator
members.doc:
A function executed for every matched node, to check whether it's to be considered into the walk or not. If not provided, all matched nodes are considered good.

If the function returns false the node is ignored.
members.short_doc:
A function executed for every matched node, to check whether
it's to be considered into the walk or not. ...

members.name: guard
members.doc:
A function executed for every node the walk pass by to check whether the walk is to be finished. It's called when both entering and exiting nodes, as well as for the matched nodes.

If this function returns false, the walking ends and no more nodes are evaluated.
members.short_doc:
A function executed for every node the walk pass by to check
whether the walk is to be finished. ...

members.name: constructor
members.doc: Creates a walker class instance.
members.short_doc: Creates a walker class instance. ...

members.name: checkBackward
members.doc: Check all nodes at left, executing the evaluation function.

return.name: return
return.doc: false if the evaluator function returned false for any of the matched nodes. Otherwise true.

members.short_doc: Check all nodes at left, executing the evaluation function. ...

members.name: checkForward
members.doc: Check all nodes at right, executing the evaluation function.

return.name: return
return.doc: false if the evaluator function returned false for any of the matched nodes. Otherwise true.

members.short_doc: Check all nodes at right, executing the evaluation function. ...

members.name: end
members.doc: Stops walking. No more nodes are retrieved if this function gets called.
members.short_doc: Stops walking. ...

members.name: lastBackward
members.doc: Executes a full walk backwards (to the left), until no more nodes are available, returning the last valid node.

return.name: return
return.doc: The last node at the left or null if no valid nodes are available.

members.short_doc:
Executes a full walk backwards (to the left), until no more nodes
are available, returning the last valid node. ...

members.name: lastForward
members.doc: Executes a full walk forward (to the right), until no more nodes are available, returning the last valid node.

return.name: return
return.doc: The last node at the right or null if no valid nodes are available.

members.short_doc:
Executes a full walk forward (to the right), until no more nodes
are available, returning the last valid node. ...

members.name: next
members.doc: Retrieves the next node (at right).

return.name: return
return.doc: The next node or null if no more nodes are available.

members.short_doc: Retrieves the next node (at right). ...

members.name: previous
members.doc: Retrieves the previous node (at left).

return.name: return
return.doc: The previous node or null if no more nodes are available.

members.short_doc: Retrieves the previous node (at left). ...

members.name: reset
members.doc: Resets walker.
members.short_doc: Resets walker. ...

members.name: blockBoundary
members.doc: Returns a function which checks whether the node is a block boundary. See CKEDITOR.dom.element.isBlockBoundary.
members.short_doc: Returns a function which checks whether the node is a block boundary. ...

members.name: bogus
members.doc: Returns a function which checks whether node is a bogus (filler) node from contenteditable element's point of view.
members.short_doc:
Returns a function which checks whether node is a bogus (filler) node from
contenteditable element's point of view. ...

members.name: bookmark
members.doc: Returns a function which checks whether the node is a bookmark node OR bookmark node inner contents.

params.name: contentOnly
params.doc: Whether only test against the text content of bookmark node instead of the element itself (default).

params.name: isReject
params.doc: Whether should return false for the bookmark node instead of true (default).

members.short_doc:
Returns a function which checks whether the node is a bookmark node OR bookmark node
inner contents. ...

members.name: editable
members.doc:
Returns a function which checks whether node can be a container or a sibling of selection end.

This includes:

  • text nodes (but not whitespaces),
  • inline elements,
  • intersection of CKEDITOR.dtd.$empty and CKEDITOR.dtd.$block (currenly it's only <hr>),
  • non-editable blocks (special case - such blocks cannot be containers nor siblings, they need to be selected entirely),
  • empty blocks which can contain text (IE only).

params.name: isReject
params.doc: Whether should return false for the ignored element instead of true (default).

members.short_doc:
Returns a function which checks whether node can be a container or a sibling
of selection end. ...

members.name: ignored
members.doc:
Returns a function which checks whether node should be ignored in terms of "editability".

This includes:

  • whitespaces (see whitespaces),
  • bookmarks (see bookmark),
  • temporary elements (see temp).

params.name: isReject
params.doc: Whether should return false for the ignored element instead of true (default).

members.short_doc: Returns a function which checks whether node should be ignored in terms of "editability". ...

members.name: invisible
members.doc: Returns a function which checks whether the node is invisible in the WYSIWYG mode.
members.short_doc: Returns a function which checks whether the node is invisible in the WYSIWYG mode. ...

members.name: listItemBoundary
members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: nodeType
members.doc: Returns a function which checks whether node's type is equal to passed one.
members.short_doc: Returns a function which checks whether node's type is equal to passed one. ...

members.name: temp
members.doc: Returns a function which checks whether node is a temporary element (element with data-cke-temp attribute) or its child.

params.name: isReject
params.doc: Whether should return false for the temporary element instead of true (default).

members.short_doc:
Returns a function which checks whether node is a temporary element
(element with data-cke-temp attribute) or its child. ...

members.name: whitespaces
members.doc: Returns a function which checks whether the node is a text node containing only whitespaces characters.
members.short_doc: Returns a function which checks whether the node is a text node containing only whitespaces characters. ...

short_doc: Utility class to "walk" the DOM inside a range boundaries. ...
